alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:03PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dale, east central Coffee and northwestern Houston Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Enterprise, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Clayhatchee, Hunt Field, Waterford, Knox Field, Gerald, Bagwells Crossroads, Lowe Army Heliport, Power Dam Road, Kelly, Shell Army Field, Cairns Aaf, Keyton and Hanchey Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
